Stem: Long, narrow, form thick tussocks. With a small sheath covering the base of the leaf join.
Leaves: Up to 60 cm long, tightly rolled, overlapping at edges, smooth rolled between fingers but rough when sliding fingers downwards.
Flowers: Clustered in group 15-25 cm long at the end of a spike. Drooping.
FruitSeeds: Purplish-brown or green. Clustered in groups at the end of the spike. With leaf-like sheath which makes them hard to pull of plant. With 4.5-9 cm long awns.
DistinguishingFeatures: Similar to Serrated tussock (*Nassella trichotoma*) but has longer leaves and a narrower seed, with much longer awns.
